intro: [WRONG START] Cucumis prophetarum subsp. zeyheren, commonly known as the Zeyher's cucumber, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Namibia. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, elongated cucurbit with a thick, green rind and a mild, slightly sweet flavor.
